links.title: The World's Fastest Drone Flies At 179.6 MPH (That's Faster Than A Tesla Model S)
links.description: The RacerX drone of the Drone Racing League reached a top speed of 179.6 miles per hour during testing, claiming the title as the fastest drone in the world. Earlier in the day of the record attempt, prototypes of the RacerX drone actually burst into flames when they reached the highest point of acceleration because of the massive amount of power.

links.title: Tesla's crash rate was reduced by 40% after introduction of Autopilot based on data reviewed by NHTSA
links.description: As reported earlier today, NHTSA is closing its investigation of the fatal accident on Tesla Autopilot without finding any defect or issuing any recall. We now have access to the full report (embedded below) and there are some interesting key findings about the crash and Tesla's Autopilot in general.

links.title: Elon Musk: 'Tesla has the real potential to be one of the most valuable companies in the world'
links.description: Even though Tesla's stock price had a tenfold increase over the last five years and it has recently surged to new highs, Elon Musk predicts that it's only the beginning. The CEO now "firmly believes" that the stock has the potential for another tenfold increase "over the next five to ten years".

links.title: Elon Musk: Robot software will make Tesla worth as much as Apple
links.description: By Elon Musk thinks his robot software can make Tesla Inc. worth as much as Apple Inc. He has the chance to prove it very soon. In three different facilities spread across America, Tesla's robot-manufacturing prowess is about to show its worth.

links.title: Autopilot Blamed For Tesla Crashing And Rolling Into A Marsh
links.description: Tesla's Autopilot is being blamed once again for causing a car crash. This time the driver claims that the vehicle suddenly accelerated in Autopilot mode, causing the car to go off the road and roll over into a marsh. According to the Kandiyohi County Sheriff's Office, the 2016 Tesla ended up on its roof with its five occupants sustaining minor injuries.
